result.execSummary:
The defendant RIAN J HEINE was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Repeater, PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. RIAN J HEINE

defendant.name: HEINE, RIAN J
defendant.address: 571 Cty Rd A, C/O Green Lake County Jail, Green Lake, WI 54941

records.addlTxt:
2:51 PM Defendant RIAN J HEINE in court, in custody.  Attorney Karen L. Marone in court for RIAN J HEINE.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. ADA recites agreement - defendant will plea to count 1 & 2 in 2021CM114, with no repeater, with jail, costs and DNA sample; in 2022CM8 defendant will plea to count 1 as charged with imposed and stayed probation and conditions and count 2 with jail, costs and DNA sample and counts 3 & 4 will be dismissed and read-in; 2021CM107, 2022CM9 and 2022CM10 will be dismissed and read-in.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant. Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights. Court goes over the elements of each offense. Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty. Court instructs defendant regarding deportation. 

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST. Court finds the plea is made knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently. Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea. Court finds the defendant guilty in 2021CM114 on counts 1 & 2 as charged but striking the repeaters; court finds the defendant Guilty on counts 1 & 2 as charged in 2022CM8 and orders the balance of the counts be dismissed and read-in and orders 2021CM107, 2022CM9 & 2022CM10 be dismissed and read-in. Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today. ADA confirms compliance with victim witness rights. Sentencing statement by ADA. Sentencing statement by Atty Marone. No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

2021CM114

-Ct 1 - 19 days county jail, credit of 19 days.
-Ct 2 - 19 days county jail, credit of 19 days.
-Court costs. Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or call the Clerk of Courts Office (920-294-4142) to set-up a payment plan. 
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample. 

2021CM8

-Ct 1 - 1 year county jail, stayed and places the defendant on probation for 2 years. No huber, out of county service or travel.

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs. To be paid to the Clerk of Courts office.  Monies are to be paid during the term of probation.  Failure to pay may result in the suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency. 
-Restitution of $300. Restitution is to be paid to the probation office.
-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance. 
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment and follow-up as recommended. 
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample. 

Count 2

-45 days county jail. Consecutive to any other sentence. Court grants huber, out-of-county service and out-of-county travel. 
-Court costs.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample. 

Court adjourned at  3:06 PM
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 3, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

NOT ON THE RECORD 

Defendant RIAN J HEINE in court, in custody.  Attorney Karen L. Marone not in court.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant has not talked with Atty Marone today. Court informs the defendant that Attorney Marine called the JA, but the JA had to leave for an appointment. Will contact the attorney tomorrow to schedule.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 23, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Second appearance on March 1, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Prior: 223 Water St Unit 3, Berlin, WI 54923

Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance. Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

No Contact with the victim or victim's residence. Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision. Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance. Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

9:13 AM Defendant RIAN J HEINE appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Gerise Laspisa appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls 22CM8, 22CM9, and 22CM10. Def has no objection to holding this hearing by zoom. Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaints and waives their reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count and as repeater. Court finds probable cause on all cases. Court instructs the defendant of his/her right to an attorney. Court determines the defendant stands mute and enters NOT GUILTY plea on all counts on behalf of the defendant. DA Laspisa makes bond recommendation. DA Laspisa confirms compliance with victim witness rights. Statement by the victim who is present in court. Statement by the defendant EL. 

Court sets bond on all cases at $5,000 cash bond and conditions of: Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance. 22CM9 Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.  22CM8 to include No contact with victim or victim's residence. Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision. Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department. Court will set for Status of Counsel Hearing on March 1, 2022 at 2:00 PM.

Court adjourned at 9:21 AM.
